results.title: Prisoner of the mountains = Kavkazsky Plennik
results.creator_credit: Sergei Bodrov, Boris Giller, BG Productions and Karavan
results.brief_description: By all appearances, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ can easily be branded a film about the conflict in Chechnya. In fact, it was conceived well before the beginning of the war and has a short story by Leo Tolstoy, ‘Prisoner of the Caucasus’, as its basis. As the war rages in the Caucasus, young recruit Vania (Sergei Bodrov, Jr.) is sent off to the front, where he befriends a wily and experienced soldier, Sasha (Oleg Menshikov). During an ambush, the pair is captured by Muslims forces and taken prisoner to a mountain village. The leader - Abdel Murat (Djemal Sikharulidze), intends to use the soldiers as exchange currency against his son, held prisoner by the Russian army. As their stay in the village extends, a mutual understanding develops between Vania and Abdel Murat as well as a tender friendship with his daughter. However, Sasha plots to use this new found understanding as a means for achieving freedom. ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ is a powerful anti-war fable exploring the universal themes of human friendship overcoming, for a luminous moment, the barriers of language, religion, culture and other physical and mental borders. Filmed on location in Daghestan, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ was cast mostly with local villager. This visual feast set among stunning mountainous landscape garnered a scoop of awards and nominations, including Best Foreign Film Oscar Nomination (1996) and the Cannes Film Festival Award (1996). In Russian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sergei Bodrov, Boris Giller, BG Productions and Karavan

results.title: Prisoner of St Petersburg
results.creator_credit: Ian Pringle, Klaus Sunger, Daniel Scharf, Panorama Films and Seon Films
results.brief_description: Noah Taylor is Jack, a young man who is obsessed by the lives of the great Russian writers. He wanders through a dreamscape in which reality entwines with characters from Dostoevsky, Tolstoy and Gogol. Penniless in a cold and bleak West Berlin, he falls in love with Elena, (Solveig Dommartin), who in his fevered imagination comes to represent Dostoevsky’s pure and ill-treated Sasha. Over the course of a magical night in Berlin, Jack, Elena and her friend Johanna search the alleys and autobahns of Berlin seeking love, solace and the promise of redemption. This idosyncratic and romantic Australian film is a lyrical celebration of human contact and communion.

results.title: Prisoner and Wentworth
results.creator_credit: Reg Grundy Productions and Fremantle International
results.brief_description: Prisoner packed a punch when it premiered in 1979, spawning international adaptations and a massive cult following. In 2013, Prisoner was rebooted as Wentworth and updated to reflect contemporary culture and female-focused themes.

constellations_primary.name: Women and crime
constellations_primary.description: The allure and fascination of dangerous women and women in danger.

results.description:
Prisoner packed a punch when it premiered in 1979. Set in the fictional suburb of Wentworth, the female-centred prison drama reverberated around the world, spawning international adaptations and a massive cult following. Almost 30 years after it left the airwaves, Prisoner was rebooted in 2013 as Wentworth and updated to reflect contemporary culture.

Wentworth has also been adapted internationally, but its impact on the local industry is just as important as its global reach, providing countless opportunities for women on both sides of the camera. It also explores complex female-focused themes including institutionalised power, female transgression and violence, motherhood and LGBTQIA+ sexuality.
description_for_label:
Prisoner packed a punch when it premiered in 1979. Set in the fictional suburb of Wentworth, the female-centred prison drama reverberated around the world, spawning international adaptations and a massive cult following. Almost 30 years after it left the airwaves, Prisoner was rebooted in 2013 as Wentworth and updated to reflect contemporary culture.

Wentworth has also been adapted internationally, but its impact on the local industry is just as important as its global reach, providing countless opportunities for women on both sides of the camera. It also explores complex female-focused themes including institutionalised power, female transgression and violence, motherhood and LGBTQIA+ sexuality.

results.title: Prisoner
results.creator_credit: Marie Trevor and Reg Grundy Productions
results.brief_description: Created by Reg Watson and screening a total of 692 episodes between 1979 and 1986, “Prisoner” was one of the first television series to tackle issues such as rape, homosexuality and violence. It did this through the relationships between a cross section of women and the women who work around them at the Wentworth Detention Centre. This groundbreaking serial funded by the Grundy Organisation was screened in countries throughout the world and was remade in Germany and the U.K. The complete title of the series overseas was “Prisoner: Cell block H”. PLEASE NOTE: the dates recorded in entries pertain to copyright year and usually preceeds the screening year.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.title: Prison walls
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Using historical documents and footage as well as dramatised re-enactments, Bill Peach describes the epic journey of Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson as they crossed the Blue Mountains and discovered the lush pastures on the other side. This video also explores the reasons why the expedition was carried out and the impact the discovery had on the growth of the young colony of New South Wales.

results.title: Prison Songs
results.brief_description: Prison Songs is a documentary musical made in 2014, during the last days of the operation of Darwin’s Berrimah Prison – the largest correctional centre in the NT.

constellations_other.name: Black documentary and truth telling
constellations_other.description: Essie Coffey was a trailblazer of Indigenous filmmaking, being the first Aboriginal woman to direct a documentary. The film spotlights the outspoken voice Coffey utilised to convey the realities faced by Aboriginal people and to encourage resistance to assimilation.

results.description: Prison Songs is a documentary musical made in 2014, during the last days of the operation of Darwin’s Berrimah Prison – the largest correctional centre in the NT.
description_for_label: Prison Songs is a documentary musical made in 2014, during the last days of the operation of Darwin’s Berrimah Prison – the largest correctional centre in the NT.

results.title: Prison on fire
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Karl Maka, Catherine Chang and Cinema City Film Production
results.brief_description: After accidentally committing a murder, a young advertising executive is sentenced to three years in prison. His clean looks and straight-forward honesty with the prison staff make him a target for the various triad factions at work in the institution, until he forms an alliance with an older prisoner who knows the ins and outs of the system. Less an action film than a drama in the prison film genre, “Prison on fire” explores themes of honour, loyalty and friendship, capturing the bleakness and despair of prison life through the drab, claustrophobic colour scheme and absence of music. Lam’s portrayal of a Chinese prison eschews the usual prison film cliches, focusing instead on how the prison environment brings out the worst in people. Cast includes Chow Yun-Fat, Tony Leung and Roy Cheung. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Prison officer. Part 1
results.brief_description: The work of prison officers in Britain, seen in the daily routine at a particular prison (Wakefield). Scenes of their training course show how trainee officers are taught to understand the male prisoner and how they can assist his rehabilitation.
